comments.body: It is Map<String, dynamic> that needs cast to <String, String> right? Would it be better to loosen that <String, String> to <String, dynamic> here instead?
We never use it for anything but String-String mappings, but JSON is String-dynamic. I think either way is fine.
If given map entry is a leaf node, then it's okay to expect String value, but what if this entry itself is a map?

going by `_checksum` and `_properties` are declared as  `Map<String,String>`

@cbracken, is there a possibility of the entry being a map?

I think I normally prefer to do type checking when retrieving particular value from json map.
So you read json into `Map<String, dynamic> _checksums`(that doesn't need typecasting), when you retrieve a value you do `String checksum = _checksums[key];`.

What you describe makes sense too. Perhaps worth adding as a comment next to the explicit cast.
Sorry Alex, merged before I saw your comment.
Not sure the implementation of `hash2()`, but this seems worse?
The hashcode itself is kind of pointless anyway - since it is hashing the lengths of the checksum/properties.
